animations

Class AnimeFrameTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • animations.AnimeFrameTest

  • public class AnimeFrameTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests the anime frame class.
    Since:
    8-8-2014
    Version:
    8-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    AnimeFrame, Image, Observer

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Does any set up for this class. Subclasses should first call super and then set their own values or change the values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the set up fails.

      • tearDown

        public void tearDown()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Does any clean up for the class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the clean up fails.

      • testGetDuration

        public void testGetDuration()
        Tests the retrieval of the duration of the frame.

      • testGetImage

        public void testGetImage()
        Tests the retrieval of the image contained in the frame.

      • testUpdatesReset

        public void testUpdatesReset()
        Tests if the AnimeFrame is reset. That is the anime frame did not call #setChanged of if it has updated. If #setChanged is called then it must notify it's Observers or this method fails.

      • testUpdatesDone

        public void testUpdatesDone()
        Tests if the AnimeFrame knows it has been updated and the update is send to the Observers, for the image.

      • testUpdatesDone2

        public void testUpdatesDone2()
        Tests if the AnimeFrame knows it has been updated and the update is send to the Observers, for the image. If subclasses test on a frame with the image located in "default icons/printer.png" this method should be overwritten.

      • testGetImageAfterSetting

        public void testGetImageAfterSetting()
        Tests if the setting of the image is done correctly.

      • testGetDurationAfterSetting

        public void testGetDurationAfterSetting()
        Tests if the setting of the duration is done correctly.

      • testEqualsWithObject

        public void testEqualsWithObject()
        Tests equality between the frame and an Object.

      • testEqualsWithException

        public void testEqualsWithException()
        Tests equality between the frame and an Exception.

      • testEqualsDifferentDuration

        public void testEqualsDifferentDuration()
        Tests equality with two different durations.

      • testEqualsDifferentDurationAndImage

        public void testEqualsDifferentDurationAndImage()
        Tests equality with two different durations and images. Subclasses that set images to printer.png should overwrite this method.

      • testEqualsDifferentImages

        public void testEqualsDifferentImages()
        Tests equality with two different Images. Subclasses that set images to printer.png should overwrite this method.

      • testEqualsSameAdress

        public void testEqualsSameAdress()
        Tests for equality of two AnimeFrames with the same adress.

      • testEqualsTrueThroughCopyingConstructor

        public void testEqualsTrueThroughCopyingConstructor()
        Tests for equality of two AnimeFrames with the same arguments.

      • testEqualsTrue

        public void testEqualsTrue()
        Tests for equality of two AnimeFrames with the same arguments.

      • setFrame

        protected final void setFrame(AnimeFrame frame)
        Sets the AnimeFrame under test to the given value. The image and duration used by AnimeFrameTest are updated as well.
        Parameters:
        frame - The new frame.

      • getFrame

        protected final AnimeFrame getFrame()
        Gets the frame used in this test.
        Returns:
        The frame under test.
